title: Sabre
description: Michael hates the changes that Dunder Mifflin's new owner is implementing, so he turns to David Wallace for advice. Jim and Pam find the perfect day care center, but Jim's mistake threatens to ruin the interview.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, yeah. [clapping and chanting] I got a big box, yes I do. I got a big box how 'bout you? [points to Erin]

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: [clapping] I got a big box, yes I do. I got a big box how 'bout you? [points to Oscar]

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I think you don't know what you're saying.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It's from "Sob-ray", our new owner, and it is to Sabre, us. I wonder what's inside. Scissor me. [Erin tosses Michael open scissors, Pam is appalled]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Dunder Mifflin was recently bought by an electronics company named Sabre. [mispronounced "sob-ray"]  They stepped in at the 11th hour, and they saved our asses.  Although David Wallace said that we were the one branch that was actually working right, so we probably could have saved our own asses. We didn't need them touching our asses.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh! [rips open cardboard box] Wow. Awesome. [distributing items] For accounting, a brand new printer. And for the sales staff, a new fax machine. This cord has Creed written all over it. And whoever would like a brand new scanner can come visit it in my office. Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Here we go. [scans stuffed animal] Oh! Wow.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Cool. What next? [Dwight puts his face on scanner]

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Guys, um, who's Gabe? This note says to put the box aside for Gabe Lewis, who's coming tomorrow?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, everybody, listen up. I have some bad news. Due to circumstances beyond my control -

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Impulsivity and inattention to detail.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, hey. I have opened a box, which should not have been opened...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Terrible mistake.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: And distributed things which should not have been distributed.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Undistributable.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Well, maybe we can put the box back together.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Impossible. He opened it like an ape.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I think we can do it.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [Pam and Oscar are trying to repack cardboard box] Yep, yep.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Right? Mm. Did we try printer first? Shredder at an angle -

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yep.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Fax, cable, then the scanner upside down?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Have you tried making everything smaller?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: And - [Jim seals box with tape, rips covered with stickers] Wow. Really nice job. This group of people, when they put their minds together, they can do something great. And I think that you should all be proud of yourselves. [cell phone starts ringing from inside box]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Alright, relax. We can do it. We just did it. So we can do this again. Erin, scissor me please. [Erin tosses open scissors across Jim and Pam]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No, don't!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [fumbles] Thank you. Oh! Got it. Ok.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Alright, he's on his way up. Okay. Are we ready?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What do you want us to do?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Why do I have to explain everything?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Because we're usually not on the same page.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay. [starts round of applause]

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Oh. Okay. And to you. [begins applauding]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Gabe seems tall. Hope we get along. Had a very good thing going with David Wallace. He was a good guy. He was somebody I could trust. Here he is. [holding up photo of him and Wallace] You can really see that he is ok taking a picture with me. Even though I was there for disciplinary reasons.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Welcome. Scranton hot dog from Scranton?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know what, Dwight? Let's give him a minute to settle in, shall we? Ok?

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Um, hi, uh, my name is Gabe Lewis. I am coordinating director for merging regions.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hello, Gabe. I am Michael Scott, co-manager. This is my protege, Jim Halpert.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Co-manager, actually.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: In training.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Trained. Loving it. Good at it. So...

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: We are very impressed with this branch and we are so excited about this merger.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: We're very excited too, aren't we guys? Right?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: So excited.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: We have a little song prepared for you.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Um, actually, if you don't mind, I would love to put this on the Sabre website. [correctly pronounced "say-ber"]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Sabre. Say-ber. Sabre.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh. Of course.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes, say-ber. Good. Take it away guys.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Ok. [playing guitar to the tune of Miley Cyrus' Party in the USA]

quotes.speaker: {andy} & {erin}
quotes.text: [singing] Hopped off the train in Scranton, PA, another cloudy gray afternoon. Jumped in the cab, here you are for the first time, look to the right see the "Electric City" sign. This is gonna be good day, for Dunder Mifflin and Sob-ray. Sab - [guitar stops]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Saber.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Saber. [sings] Dunder Mifflin and Saber. So yeah, yeah, yay, yay.

quotes.speaker: {andy} & {erin}
quotes.text: Dunder Mifflin is a part of Sob-ray. So yeah, yeah, yay, yay. Dunder Mifflin is a part of Sabre. [music stops]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: You sure it's saber?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Thank you. Hey, we should be fine if we leave around 11:20.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, you mapquested it. It's four blocks away.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well, now we won't get lost. Or we could drive. And that takes one minute.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: We found a great local daycare. It's rated really high by all the local parenting websites. But that means it's also really hard to get into.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Turns out, a lot of parents want the very best for their children. That's weird.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: We're hoping our interview seals the deal.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: But if not, there's always the army. The infantry.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay. Okay. Yeah.

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [Gabe starts DVD]

quotes.speaker: Christian
quotes.text: So you've just been bought by Sabre. You've probably got a lot of questions. Hi. I'm Christian Slater. What's it like to work for Sabre? Let's find out together. Working at Sabre means taking on the challenge of the road that rises to meet you. Sabre is respecting the past, but opening a window to the future. Have you ever tasted a rainbow? At Sabre, you will.

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: You'll find it easy to embrace the Sabre spirit. Welcome. We're very excited to go on this journey with you.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [Christian Slater impression] So you've been shown a nonsensical video. You're probably wondering, "What's going on?" Well, you're not alone.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Wow. Really terrific.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Most of our business comes from selling printers. So don't think of yourselves as paper salesmen anymore, but as printer salesmen who also sell paper.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Perfect.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No. Don't like that.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: At Sabre, we really encourage honest communication. You should always feel free to express your thoughts, your -

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Talk about vacation days!

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: We have a policy here at Sabre where we are, uh, allowed to take two weeks.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: But I banked six weeks.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I already booked a Great Lakes cruise.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Hey, who the hell's going through our stuff?

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Actually, that's Nick. He's your new IT guy. Uh, he's setting up a site blocker. Mostly blocking the inappropriate sites.  And then there are the time-wasting sites like Twitter, YouTube. We are blocking those as well.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Mm, nope. Don't like that.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Ok, did everyone get one? With these bottles, we eliminate the need for plastic water bottles, which are the scourge of the environment.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: We'll still get to use the little cups, though, right?

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Little cups? Like paper or plastic or... ?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I don't know what they're made of.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: They're 2 ounce paper cups dipped in plastic. He goes through 20 a day.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Ok, well, I bet you can fit 20 little cups of water in your aluminum bottle.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know what can't fit in a bottle, are the 20 little trips I take to the cooler, and the 20 little scans I do of everybody to make sure everything's running smoothly. And the 20 little conversations that I have with Stanley.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: That's ok.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: There is a small part of me that is actually very excited about this new company. But 70 percent of me is water, and the other part, the real part, the part that has feelings and emotions and thoughts and makes decisions and, if I can be crass, makes babies, that part thinks that all of these changes suck ba -

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [in line to fill up water bottle behind Kevin and Toby] Really? You don't have enough water in there? Your stomach?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Oop.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Looks like we kicked it. [indicates water jug is empty]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I miss the old Dunder Mifflin. Too much change is not a good thing. Ask the climate.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I don't want to appear ungrateful for everything Sabre's doing for us.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Oh, I don't get that sense at all from you, so...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, you should have a little. But it's great that you don't, because I am trying to embrace all of these changes, but I'm - I'll be honest, I'm having trouble wrapping my head around a couple of 'em.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Which ones?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All of them.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Well, I wish that I could do something, but it's kind of policy, you know? Above my pay grade. You know?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So maybe we should call. We should call someone. I could help. I'm good with bosses. Call one of the higher-ups?

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: You know what? Let me see what I can do.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [after entering daycare] Ok, this is officially the cutest thing I've ever seen. Cubbies. I totally forgot about cubbies.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: There's a finger-painting station and a curly slide. Am I too old to go here?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh. Adorable, right? [opens kiddie bathroom, sees man on toilet] I walked in on someone in the bathroom.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I just walked in on someone in the bathroom.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Who? The -

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I don't know. I don't know.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: The guy we're meeting with?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I don't know, I don't know.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I am telling you, there are no strawberries in here.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Well, I saw them in there.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Well maybe they ran away, because the pizza was like, [imitating Italian accent] "Hey, get out of here, you stupid strawberries."

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: I think when Andy finally asks me out he's going to try to top what he did with the drum line. I can't wait to see what he comes up with.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: The ball's totally in Erin's court. After the whole drum line thing.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: [on videochat]  First let me say that I told them everything you wanted me to say, in just the way you wanted me to say it, so...

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: Gabe, honey, I love this. I love the sound of your voice. But I really need some new information now.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Ok, um, I told the story of your uncle, and I have a feeling that you would have [Michael gesturing behind computer] really been proud of the way... Okay, um...

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: Wait a minute, who is it? Who's there? Is there somebody in the room with you? [Michael gesturing "no"] I want to see who it is. Turn me around.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: I don't - it's just...

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: Turn me around. Now. [Michael starts to leave, Jo whistles] Hey, Buddy. Is it something I said?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hello. No. My name's Michael Scott. Hello.

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: Oh, hello, Mr. Scott. Pleased to meet you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Nice to meet you. We are very excited about the merger with Sabre. I think you have a great accent.

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: Aw, thank you. I've been working on it since I was a little girl. To, um, to what do I owe the pleasure of this videochat?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, I am little concerned with all of these changes, to be quite frank. I think we have done things a certain way here at Dunder Mifflin for quite some time, and -

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: Pardon. Pardon me, Mr. Scott, but the last time I saw a company as mismanaged as Dunder Mifflin, it was my grandson's snowball company, so you'll excuse me if I prefer that you all adapt to the way that we do things.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ok. I feel very strongly that you can't just come in here and change everything that people have been doing forever. Is Christian Slater back there? Because... he knows. He'd know what to do.

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: So listen, why don't you tell Gabe if by the end of the day you can't handle the changes.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I have already told him, but I will tell him again if you think that will help.

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: I would take until the end of the day if I were you. [Michael leaves conference room]

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [Michael throws aluminum bottle out of car window, breaks a windshield, speeds out of parking lot]

quotes.speaker: Jerry
quotes.text: Pam and Jim? Hey, I'm Jerry.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hi Jerry.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Jerry.

quotes.speaker: Jerry
quotes.text: Good to see you. Come on in. My office is right back here. This is the play room.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: This is great. Got to confess, we came a little early, so we got a quick look around, but, uh -

quotes.speaker: Jerry
quotes.text: Oh, so you saw it already?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No, no, no, no. Yes. We saw this, yes. No, it wasn't like a look around. We really just had a peek. Quick peek. Didn't focus on anything in particular.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: It's lovely.

quotes.speaker: Jerry
quotes.text: [cell phone rings] Oh. Got to take this. Sorry.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Do it.

quotes.speaker: Jerry
quotes.text: Okay. Hi, this is Jerry.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Ok, you've got to pull it together.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: We should just go. He's really uncomfortable.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: He's uncomfortable because you're acting weird. So you have to stop acting weird.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What if we just bring it up? We just put it out in the open?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: That's the weirdest possible solution to the problem.

quotes.speaker: Jerry
quotes.text: Sorry about that. Right this way.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: All right.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I have come here today to talk to Mr. David Wallace about this whole thing going on with Sabre. [rings doorbell] He will know exactly what to do. He is not a big fan of me dropping by announced. But then again, who is? [loud drumming as door opens] Hey. Hi, sorry.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I hope you're not busy doing something.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: No, you kidding? Come on in. Come on.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You sure?

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: You look great.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You look great too.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: You hungry? I'm just having lunch.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, yeah, that sounds good.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Fantastic. Teddy, look who just stopped in.

quotes.speaker: Teddy
quotes.text: Huh? Hey. [continues drumming]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey. Wow.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Keep it up, son.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Really loud.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Wow. Oh, yummy. [David spreads marshmallow fluff on bread] You have got the life, my friend.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Can I just stay here and never go back?

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Things not going so well there?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, man. How much time do you have?

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: I have a doctor's appointment next Thursday.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Mrs. Wallace
quotes.text: Hey, honey. How's your day going? Did you do anything cool?

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Uh, no, sweetie. I just sort of hung out.

quotes.speaker: Mrs. Wallace
quotes.text: Oh, 'cause I saw you had shoes on, so I didn't know if you did anything.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: No. Just hanging out, honey. You remember Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hi. Sorry, I was just in the neighborhood, thought I'd come by, see...

quotes.speaker: Mrs. Wallace
quotes.text: No problem at all. This is great. So what are you guys up to?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I don't know.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Uh, but maybe, uh - actually, you know, I think maybe we'll go outside. May -maybe we'll go outside. [drumming intensifies] Outside.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: There was one thing we were curious about, uh, your flexibility on things like Easter or Memorial Day, because we might want to change our days around a little bit.

quotes.speaker: Jerry
quotes.text: That seems a bit premature, don't you think? I don't even know if I have a space for you yet, and you're already lining up your holiday plans.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, no, sorry. Just, um, we're kind of planners. But we're also flexible too, so you know what? Maybe we can just discuss it when the time comes.

quotes.speaker: Jerry
quotes.text: Yeah, if the time comes, we can discuss it.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Is this because Jim walked in on you going to the bathroom?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Jerry
quotes.text: Seriously? You told her?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Did it? It might have come up while we were waiting for you.

quotes.speaker: Jerry
quotes.text: And you - you thought that might have something to do with how the meeting is going?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Maybe, because it doesn't seem to be going super well.

quotes.speaker: Jerry
quotes.text: Well, you didn't consider the fact that it might not be going super well just because it might not be going super well?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Nope. 'Cause we're really nice people but you don't seem to like us.

quotes.speaker: Jerry
quotes.text: I'm being perfectly pleasant. Did you ever consider that you might not be as charming as you think you are?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, this coming from the guy who still uses a children's toilet? Why didn't you just lock the door, man?

quotes.speaker: Jerry
quotes.text: It doesn't lock for the children's safety.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Anybody could have walked in.

quotes.speaker: Jerry
quotes.text: It was story time.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Sabre is changing everything. [Michael and David sitting in hot tub] Site blockers. They don't let us use cups. So I started thinking, who could handle this? Who would know what to do? David Wallace would know what to do. What should I do, David Wallace?

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: I don't know. I mean, what can you do?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Exactly. What are you thinking?

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: I, I - It's a tough one.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It is a tough one.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: I don't have any ideas for you there.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah. But one would be good.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Hey, oh, okay. Wait.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: I want to tell you about a business idea I have.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Ok? You know how kids leave their toys everywhere? Okay. So this is a vacuum. It's like a shop-vac type of thing. [imitates vacuum] Teaches kids how to pick up their own toys. Right? Baseball gloves, hacky sacks, drumsticks. [sucking noise] Picks it up!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So the kid's making the noise to pick it up.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: No. No, no, no. That's the -that's the vacuum noise.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, okay.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: You-you don't like it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, I think it is-

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: No, it's ok. Another guy from Dunder Mifflin, Arnie from Research, he's gonna draw up the prototype. And, uh... It's like shop-vac. [sucking noise] Did I say that?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yep.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: It'll be ok.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Hey, any fun weekend plans?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: No, you?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Uh, no, actually. So nothing? No movies, or parties, or anything you might want to invite someone to?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Nothing. It's wide open.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: That's as hard as I can hint.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Hey, you know, if you want, I'm sure I can get Arnie on board if you wanted to join us for suck it. Work together again.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: The what?

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Suck it. That's what it's called.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, okay.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Huh? Catchy. Kids'll love it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Like it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: There are very few things that would make me not want to team up with David Wallace. And Suck It is one of 'em.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: See you later. [hugs Wallace]

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Oh, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Bye now.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Thank you for coming.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Thanks for having me.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, that's not the David Wallace that I remember. [reverses out of driveway, Wallace follows him] That is some sort of weird creature that lives in David Wallace's house. Oh, my god. Alright. Just get me out of here.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hello. [comes in carrying 4 gallons of orange juice and his water bottle] Is anybody home? Oh, thank you, Erin. Now if everyone would please ready their canteens, so I can fill them with the sweet, sweet nectar of Gabe's homeland, and then propose a toast. Here we go.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know when people say getting fired was the best thing that ever happened to them? I feel sorry for those people. That's the best thing? Really? Ugh.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, I'm not really one for making speeches.

quotes.speaker: Everyone
quotes.text: Yes. Yes, you are. You make a lot.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: But I feel pretty good right now. I really do. A lot better than I did earlier. Let me tell you.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: That's your toast?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No. This is my toast.  I think this whole thing with Sabre is going to work out. I have a very good feeling about it.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Michael, this isn't a toast. You're just thinking out loud.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Here's my toast. Orange juice is in here. And, like Saber, it is from Florida, and it is good.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Just 'cause you have liquid that doesn't make it a toast.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Here's the toast. I'm gonna do it now. Raise your container to us and to Sabre.

quotes.speaker: All
quotes.text: To us and to Sabre.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Mm. Wow. That is metallicy. Ugh. That's like drinking a battery. Ah, really gets you in the fillings, doesn't it? Okay, anyway, welcome.

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [David Wallace at keyboard, Teddy playing drums]

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: [singing] Well, it's a mess, what a mess. What you gonna do? You're going to take out your Suck It and you suck it. Suck it. Yeah, take out your Suck It and you suck it.

quotes.speaker: Teddy
quotes.text: Suck it!

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Yeah!

quotes.speaker: Teddy
quotes.text: Suck it!

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Yeah!

quotes.speaker: Teddy
quotes.text: Suck it!

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Yeah! Take out the Suck It and we'll...

quotes.speaker: Teddy
quotes.text: Suck it!

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Yeah!

quotes.speaker: Teddy
quotes.text: Suck it!

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Yeah!

quotes.speaker: Both
quotes.text: Take out my Suck It and we'll suck it.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Yeah! Teddy!

quotes.speaker: Teddy
quotes.text: Yeah. [high-five each other]
